comments:
I'm working with the following class:


package com.qnx.tools.utils.ui.controls;

import org.eclipse.jface.viewers.DialogCellEditor;
import org.eclipse.jface.viewers.TableViewer;
import org.eclipse.swt.SWT;
import org.eclipse.swt.events.DisposeEvent;
import org.eclipse.swt.events.DisposeListener;
import org.eclipse.swt.events.KeyAdapter;
import org.eclipse.swt.events.KeyEvent;
import org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite;
import org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Control;
import org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Event;
import org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Listener;
import org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Text;

public abstract class DialogTextCellEditor extends DialogCellEditor {
	private Text text;


	protected DialogTextCellEditor(Composite parent) {
		super(parent);
	}
	
	protected Control createContents(Composite cell) {
		text = new Text(cell, SWT.LEFT);
		text.setFont(cell.getFont());
		text.setBackground(cell.getBackground());
		text.addKeyListener(new KeyAdapter() {
			// hook key pressed - see PR 14201  
			public void keyPressed(KeyEvent e) {
	            keyReleaseOccured(e);
	            
			}
		});
		/*
		text.addDisposeListener(new DisposeListener() {
			public void widgetDisposed(DisposeEvent e) {
				// If it happens, we don't know should the text value to be accepted
				// However the upper level knows that and uses or not uses this value
				// depending on the circumstances
				setValue(text.getText());
			}
		});
		*/
		return text;
	}
	
	protected void updateContents(Object value) {
		if((null != text) && !text.isDisposed()) {
			if (value != null)
				text.setText(value.toString());
			else
				text.setText(""); //$NON-NLS-1$
		} else
			super.updateContents(value);
	}
	
	/**
	 * @see DialogCellEditor#doGetValue()
	 */
	
	protected Object doGetValue() {
		if((null != text) && text.isDisposed()) 
			return text.getText();
		return super.doGetValue();
	}
	
	/**
	 * Since a text editor field is scrollable we don't
	 * set a minimumSize.
	 */
	public LayoutData getLayoutData() {
		return new LayoutData();
	}


	/**
	 * @see CellEditor#doSetFocus()
	 */
	protected void doSetFocus() {
		super.doSetFocus();
		if (text != null) {
			text.selectAll();
			text.setFocus();
		}
		
	}


	/* This is a temporary fixing. Real problem is in Eclipse
	 * (see bug report # 34819). To make it work properly in
	 * 6.3 which is supposed to use 2.1.1, I have to change our code.
	 * (non-Javadoc)
	 * @see
org.eclipse.jface.viewers.CellEditor#createControl(org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Composite)
	 */
	protected Control createControl(Composite parent) {
		Control control = super.createControl(parent);
		control.addListener(SWT.Deactivate, new Listener() {
			public void handleEvent(Event event) {
				DialogTextCellEditor.this.focusLost();
			}
		});
		return control;	}

}
If I select Source->Override/Implement Methods, then check
CellEditor.fireApplyEditorValue, I get an exception message. The trace log can
be found below.

- new plugin project Test
- accept the defaults of the wizard
- created the corresponding package and class
- run Override/Implement methods
